description: If you like Notepad++, you'll like Notepadqq

I've always loved the app but had to remove due to obsolete KDE 5.11 runtime in the flatpak.
Info: org.kde.PlatformTheme.QGnomePlatform//5.11 is end-of-life, with reason:
  The KDE 5.11 runtime is no longer supported and does not receive security updates. We strongly recommend migrating to a supported runtime.
Info: org.kde.Platform//5.11 is end-of-life, with reason:

Work good on Fedora.

Recommended this programs
I'm using Peppermint OS 11, I'm not sure why does my applications looks like a classic windows application instead of modern interface like the screenshot.

love the feature similar to Notepad++ where you don't need to save a document and keep information on several tabs without the need of saving it. But i keep getting the same error message "Notepadqq was not closed properly. Do you want to recover unsaved changes?"
summary: could be smaller and and more stable

description: I am using this on my fedora 38 kde version...and its automatically closes in a few seconds.
Works for the most part as far as I can tell. No obvious / simple way to rename tabs which is a big let down.
summary: No obvious way to rename tabs

description: As of Jan 2024 this project has been abandoned. The existing version has basic functionality, it can launch and open documents but there are many bugs. Code highlighting is not functional, code color themes are not respected when selected from the preferences dialog only showing black and white text, scrolling with the mouse scroll wheel does not work, etc.
does its job, a cool editor with cool features. Dont have a extentions section so im giving 4 stars but it is perfect.
Some update broke it, can't even scroll anymore, themes don't work

I use Notepad++ for html and css coding of web site and like the ability to switch back and fourth between both files being open to edit and create.
This program Notepadqq is a good second alternative in the event you need both the css and html open at the same time for following a stream of coding events.  One thing that would make this program better is a scroll bar on the right side of the gui interface.   Page Up and Page Down work along with arrow keys for moving through a page yet sometimes a scroll bar is more convenient.

If you like Notepadd++ yet do not like using WINE for some reason this program is a possible alternative.
summary: Good altenative for situations where you need two files opened

description: Easy to install. Lacks column/block editing which is the main reason for my installing it.
summary: Works well, but needs to support more feature

description: Läuft bei mir unter Nobara Linux 39 problemlos. Startet schnell und schaut zweckmäßig aus. Keine Probleme bisher.
Sería perfecto si tuviera una opción para comentar muchas líneas de código al mismo tiempo con un atajo de teclas o bien, con una opción del menú contextual!
Стабильность работы под вопросом. Также данный редактор не умеет работать с SSH в отличие от стандартного текстового редактора GNOME
summary: Нестабильная работа + не умеет работать с SSH
